getTimestamp().Description: Obtains the timestamp of the versioned module or informal unit. This data is read from the version information for the package.

Returns: a string holding this version information
toString().Description: Provides the version information in human-readable format.

Returns: the version information for the argument package, or null if not available
Parameters: the package for which to load version information, for example "org.apache.http". The package name should NOT end with a dot.
the classloader to load from, or null for the thread context classloader
loadVersionInfo(java.lang.String, java.l.Description: Loads version information for a package.
loadVersionInfo(java.lang.String, java.l.FullName: public static final VersionInfo loadVersionInfo (String pckg, ClassLoader clsldr)

VersionInfo(java.lang.String, java.lang..FullName: protected VersionInfo (String pckg, String module, String release, String time, String clsldr)

getPackage().Description: Obtains the package name. The package name identifies the module or informal unit.

Returns: the version information for all packages found, never null
Parameters: the packages for which to load version info
the classloader to load from, or null for the thread context classloader
loadVersionInfo(java.lang.String[], java.Description: Loads version information for a list of packages.
loadVersionInfo(java.lang.String[], java.FullName: public static final VersionInfo[] loadVersionInfo (String[] pckgs, ClassLoader clsldr)

Parameters: the package for the version information
the map from string keys to string values, for example @B_java#util#Properties_E@
fromMap(java.lang.String, java.util.Map,.FullName: protected static final VersionInfo fromMap (String pckg, Map info, ClassLoader clsldr)

getClassloader().Description: Obtains the classloader used to read the version information. This is just the toString output of the classloader, since the version information should not keep a reference to the classloader itself. That could prevent garbage collection.

getModule().Description: Obtains the name of the versioned module or informal unit. This data is read from the version information for the package.

getRelease().Description: Obtains the release of the versioned module or informal unit. This data is read from the version information for the package.

ClassDesc: Please use @B_java#net#URL#openConnection_E@ instead. Please visit Provides access to version information for HTTP components. Instances of this class provide version information for a single module or informal unit, as explained All available version information is provided in strings, where the string format is informal and subject to change without notice. Version information is provided for debugging output and interpretation by humans, not for automated processing in applications.
